result.heading: THE PAST 43 A CIRCLE OF OFFICERS

direction.raw_text: . FORT BRAGG - NIGHT - THE PAST                         43 A CIRCLE OF OFFICERS including MAJOR HOLTZ sit around
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: who has surrounded himself with a pseudo-forest of plants. There are candles everywhere. His face is painted. SUPERED TITLES read Fort Bragg. 1980.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The OFFICERS stare at him. There are sniggers. Bill stares them down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They finish. Bill nods, smiling, stares around at them.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I'd like us to begin this with a mantra. If we could all breathe in and then out, holding a long "eeeeee."
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Breathe in...(they comply) and out...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: EEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEE ee.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We are a Hollow Army, gentlemen. Vietnam has crushed our soul. We are traumatized and melancholic. We are ashamed. That is why I have brought you to this place of Sanctuary. Here we can mend our wounds and dream our dreams. My dream is of an America that will lead the world to paradise, an America that no longer has an exploitative view of natural resources, that no longer promotes consumption at all costs. I believe this is America's destiny. (MORE) (CONTINUED)
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Bill finishes. We TRACK along the OFFICERS' FACES - really not sure what to do or say. We reach one officer who looks like Lee Marvin. This is BRIGADIER GENERAL DEAN HOPGOOD. His eyes are shining with excitement.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: But to achieve it we must become the first Superpower to develop super powers. We must create Warrior Monks - men and women who can fall in love with everyone, sense plant auras, pass through walls, stop saying mindless cliches and see into the future. I want you to JOIN me in this vision. (Beat) Be ALL you can BE.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) Amongst Bill's audience that night was Brigadier General Dean Hopgood, from the Defense Intelligence Agency. For some time the General had been concerned about information he had been receiving about Soviet research into psychic powers.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . POOL - DAY - THE PAST                                44 Wearing trunks, the Brigadier General lounges by his pool, engrossed in a PAPER-BACK BOOK titled Psychic Discoveries Behind the Iron Curtain.

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) According to some stories the Soviets were psychically spying on American bases and had designed "psychotronic generators" - machines capable of bombarding the President with negative energy.

direction.raw_text: Lyn stares at the number.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Take out number four.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) Lyn said he had no intention of killing the goat.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . DESERT - NIGHT - THE PRESENT                        140 Lyn flushes with indignation at the memory.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He turns to look at Bob, haunted.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: There was no way! What had the goat ever done to me? It was totally against the way of the Jedi. I was just going to pretend to try so they would say, "okay - it can't be done" and forget about it. But then, as I sat there, I felt this, this pulse start inside of me and...I couldn't stop it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You know what I keep thinking?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . ABANDONED HOSPITAL - LYN'S ROOM - THE PAST          141 CLOSE ON LYN ...as he stares, concentrating. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) Maybe deep down inside some dark part of me wanted to see if I could do it?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . ABANDONED HOSPITAL - GOAT ROOM - DAY - THE PAST     142 VIDEO FOOTAGE Grainy, flickering black and white footage of the six goats in the room. Suddenly one of them goes down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . ABANDONED HOSPITAL - LYN'S ROOM - THE PAST          143 A soldier runs into the room. Holtz, Hooper and Lyn turn to him, the atmosphere electric with dread and anticipation.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The three men stare at him.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: The goat is dead.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Goat number four?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No. Number five.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . DESERT - NIGHT - THE PRESENT                        144 Bob stares at Lyn aghast.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bob shakes his head, stares out into the darkness. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Collateral damage?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (eyes glistening) Collateral damage. (Beat) That was it. I'd used my powers for evil and it was like I brought a curse upon us all. Like that poem where the guy kills the seagull and they make him wear it round his neck. Every night I'd dream of that goat in its little bib, it's mouth opening and closing but nothing coming out...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Lyn flicks a suspicious glance at Bob, but is reassured by his solemn expression.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: The silence of the goats.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I finished my tour and I quit. I walked out of the unit and I never went back.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . FORT BRAGG - DAY                                       145 Lyn, wearing civilian clothes and holding a suitcase, is walking off the base. He reaches the gates and turns for one last look at the place that has been his home.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lyn tuns back to the gates and finds Larry Hooper standing in front of him, looking WIRED.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Before he can finish Larry CHOPS his hand down in an odd blow onto Lyn's forehead. Lyn staggers back a little, holding his head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Larry has already darted around him with a crazy laugh and is running madly back into the base. Lyn stares after him, stunned.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) But before he could leave Larry arranged one last parting gift.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What do you wan...?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What the hell?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) (CONT'D) It was the Dim Mak.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . DESERT - NIGHT - THE PRESENT                           146 Bob looks at Lyn, puzzled.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: The Dim Mak?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The Dim Mak. The Quivering Palm. The Death Touch. It's like this legendary, martial arts move. It was forbidden in the New Earth Army. Larry had got it from a mail- order book. (CONTINUED)
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: He flops back, too tired to talk anymore. Bob watches him as he falls asleep.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: What does the Death Touch do?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (Beat, patiently) It kills you Bob. With one touch.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Jesus.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: There's a story that Wong Wifu, great Chinese martial artist, had a fight with some guy and had him beat when the guy gave him this light tap, and Wong looked at him and the guy just nodded. That was it. He'd given him the death touch and Wong died.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Then and there?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No. Eighteen years later. That's the weird thing with Dim Mak - you never know when it's going to take effect.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . DESERT - MORNING                                      147 The same horizon, the dunes now burning under the sun. We
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: back and find Bob and Lyn lying asleep, lips cracked, dehydrated, exhausted. Faintly we hear a sound - a tinny BELL. It gets closer. Groggily Bob opens his eyes just as a GOAT walks into the frame and walks past him, the bell tied around its neck. Bob lies, watching it pass, trying to work out if it's a hallucination. He struggles to his feet and sets off up the berm he's been lying at the foot of. The goat walks on ahead of Bob, crests the top of the berm and disappears from sight. Bob reaches the top of the berm and stands, swaying, staring down at something.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - stunned.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BERM - DAY                                          148 Bob is dragging a barely conscious Lyn up the berm, following the goat. He staggers, barely able to put one foot in front of the other. At last we crest the top of the berm and find ourselves looking down on a WATER-HOLE, fringed with palms. The goat stands drinking. It stops to look up at us.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . WATER-HOLE - DAY                                    149 Bob and Lyn collapse into the wet mud of the hole. Bob manages to cup some water into Lyn's mouth and then his own. He rolls onto his back, stares up at the burning sky. We hear a dull roaring, muffled, growing in volume. A HELICOPTER is approaching...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . In the BLACK we hear a VOICE.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) (in Arabic,
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: ) In America if I do not like my cell-phone company I change them. I am in charge. This is consumer power.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . ARMY BASE - INFIRMARY - DAY                         150 OVERHEAD SHOT - Lyn and Bob lie side by side in beds, both hooked up to IV's. Sunlight slants through the shutters on the window in the cool room. The voice is coming from a SPEAKER on the wall.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lyn opens his eyes, looks around him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lyn looks at the door and for a second there's a FLASH OF A FACE staring in through the glass. Then it's gone. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) This is democracy. Let us work together for that. And please stop shooting at those who are only here to help.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) (CONT'D) This is an old one from Cat Stevens. (Correcting himself) Yusef Islam. That's Yusef Islam.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Over the speaker comes the sound of a period song. Lyn sits up, staring at the door. Bob stirs in his bed.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Lyn?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . ARMY BASE - CORRIDOR - DAY                          151 Lyn walks unsteadily out of the room, towing his IV drip behind him. The door at the end of the corridor is just CLOSING. Lyn sets off down the corridor. Bob appears in the doorway behind him, towing his own IV.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Lyn? Where are you going?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: - MOMENTS LATER                         152 Lyn passes doors, glances into the rooms beyond...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .O.V - the room seems to house a PRINTING PRESS. A SOLDIER stands with his back to us, watching LEAFLETS fire out of the press. We pass to the next room which seems to be a RECORDING STUDIO - the walls covered in shelves of CD's. A SOLDIER sits with headphones on playing an electronic keyboard...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . ARMY BASE BUILDING - DAY                            153 Lyn emerges blinking into the light. He stares around him. The song is playing over speakers, echoing eerily around the base. A door slides shut with a clang nearby and Lyn turns to locate the sound. A trail of FOOTPRINTS leads across the sand to a HANGAR nearby. Lyn heads off across the sand, dragging the IV. Bob emerges behind him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lyn reaches the sliding doors of the building and drags them open and stands staring into the gloomy interior. Bob catches him up. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Lyn!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: He stops following Lyn's gaze...
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I don't think we should...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The place is full of GOATS. Lyn and Bob stare at the animals. Slowly Lyn advances into the darkness, peering around him. In the shadows at the back of the building a figure
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Lyn walks slowly forward until he can make out the man - old, bearded, worn and wasted by years of heavy drinking. It's BILL DJANGO. Lyn stares at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bill smiles hesitantly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lyn is too choked with emotion for a moment to answer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bob is too amazed to reply.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bob and Lyn turn to find Larry Hooper standing in the doorway behind them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lyn stares at Larry - shocked.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Hello Bill.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hello Lyn.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: This is Bob.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hello Bob.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) Oh good...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: ...the gang's all here.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . BASE - PSIC HQ - DAY                                 154 Larry and Bill are showing Bob and Lyn around. A few
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: are working at computers behind them.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: This is primarily a Psyops base. (CONTINUED)
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Bob picks up a LEAFLET.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lyn is staring at Bill who is looking a little vacantly at the racks of CD's. Larry notices.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Larry smiles a little mockingly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bob nods a little nervously.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Psy for psychic?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Psy for psychological, although the irony isn't wasted on me. Radio broadcasts, leaflets, that sort of thing.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh, that's an Iraqi Psyops leaflet they dropped on us.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: "American Soldier - your wives are back home having sex with Bart Simpson and Bert Reynolds."
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah, hadn't exactly done their homework there.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: How'd you find us, Lyn?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I remote viewed you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: If this is Psyops what are you doing here?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I said primarily Psyops. This is a restricted area, you understand? Everything you hear and see stays secret or you go to prison.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: There are individuals in the current administration who are looking for...creative solutions for the War on Terror. (MORE) (CONTINUED)
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: He indicates the PSIC name badge he's wearing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bill frowns at the CDs, not seeming to hear.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He puts the disc in a player and presses play. We hear a burst of a period song.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: They're far more open minded then their predecessors, and they've out-sourced experimental research to my company.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: "Sick?"
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's pronounced psi-ike. Psychic Systems International Corp. Turns out certain people had heard about the New Earth Army and were interested in some of the work we were doing back then. They got in touch with me, I got in touch with Bill.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (To Bill) You're working for him?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Bill's been looking into subliminal messaging. (Selecting a disc) This is one we've designed to play to our own troops before combat.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: There's a subliminal message in this?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (reading the CD) This is..."Don't get drunk before firing heavy machine guns." We've got all sort of products in development.(To Worker) Tell them one of our new ideas.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Air bag mine?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Air bag mine. Non-lethal mine, catapults the fucker up into air. (To another) Gimme another one.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Blast target with pheromones and then release Attack Bees. (CONTINUED)
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: He turns back to Lyn.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bill stands up and starts walking a little unsteadily towards the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Larry waits until Bill has left before turning back to Lyn.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Larry shakes his head in apparent sorrow. Then he notices some candy on a desk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He picks it up and starts to eat it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lyn shakes his head, trying not to show the emotions he is feeling.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Excellent. Attack Bees. The Forces of Nature! Another.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Project Achilles. We mutilate enemy corpses and...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We're not doing that anymore! (Throwing an eraser at the worker) Idiot!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The point is we've got a budget, we've got supporters. I'm rebuilding the New Earth Army. Only this time without the hippy crap.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You okay Bill?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (Without turning) Gonna get some ice-cream.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You get the odd flash of what he used to be but... he's pretty burnt out with the booze.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Ooo, Twizzlers.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (To Lyn) You want one?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (Watching him) God, I love these things...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . BASE - CORRIDOR - DAY                               155 Bob helps Lyn down the corridor. Lyn suddenly stops, listening. There is a faint sound of MUSIC coming from somewhere nearby.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BASE - CELL CORRIDOR - DAY                          156 Lyn walks down the corridor, Bob following. At the end of the corridor is a single door with a SPY-HOLE. The loud music is coming from there. We can hear now that it is an annoying children's show song or heavy metal. We TRACK towards the door... Lyn hesitates then slides back the SPY-HOLE cover and peers in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .O.V - An IRAQI PRISONER sits huddled in the cell, illuminated in the flashes of a powerful STROBE LIGHT OVERHEAD.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The prisoner looks terrified, and despite the whimsical music the whole scene is horribly sinister. Lyn steps away from the spy-hole.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) (Lyrics from chosen song.)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What? What is it?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's the Dark Side.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . ARMY BASE - TENT - DAY                              157 Lyn sits on his bed, as low as we've ever seen him. Bob watches him, concerned.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lyn stares at the wall.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: What are you going to do?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Lyn? What are you going to do?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's too late...I'm dying, Bob. (CONTINUED)
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: He lapses into silence. Bob is stunned. Lyn lies down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lyn pulls the EAGLE FEATHER from the chain around his neck.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bob stares at him.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Oh, you're not dying! I don't believe you can kill someone with a mail order Dim Sum. You can't...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Dim Mak.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Whatever. I don't believe you can just...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's cancer.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: ...just tap someone and ...it...(Beat) What?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I mean, I know it was caused by the Dim Mak. But...it's...you know...it's cancer. That's what the doctors say. Different ways of looking at...different names for a reality or, or uh...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I shouldn't have come Bob. Shouldn't have come.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: ...Give this back to Bill...I don't deserve it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . BASE - DAY                                          158 Bill Django sits cross-legged in the sand, drinking from a bottle of whiskey, watching the sun set. Bob marches up to him, stands awkward but determined.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bill doesn't answer. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I think you should go and see Lyn, sir. (Beat) he needs you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Bill takes a long drink, stares at the sky. Bob watches him with mounting frustration.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bill doesn't react. Bob starts to walk away then turns back, and throws the FEATHER down at Bill's feet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Beat. Bill turns to look at Bob for the first time. He takes a long drink.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bill stares at the feather.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He looks around for inspiration - notices a LONE CLOUD floating in the sky. Bob places his fingers on his temples and STARES at the cloud, focuses, desperate, hopeful... Bill notices and watches, curious. Slowly, the cloud fades and DISAPPEARS. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: The man crossed a desert to see you again.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You know, he told me all these stories about Bill Django, and I was pretty excited to meet you, but I've gotta tell you...you're one big disappointment.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He told me to give you that back. I don't know why. Its supposed to be a mark of honour isn't it? I don't see how you deserve that.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It isn't real.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What isn't?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The feather. Twenty thousand dollar fine for taking an eagle feather. This one's off a turkey. You just die the tip black. (Beat) Don't tell Lyn.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: None of it was real.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That isn't true. That isn't true.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Bob can't believe it. He looks at Bill who is staring at him. He has tears in his eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . ARMY BASE - TENT - NIGHT                         159 Lyn lies sleeping. Larry sits at the foot of his bed, smoking a cigar. He watches Lyn for a moment, then COUGHS deliberately. Nothing. He repeats the cough - louder. Lyn wakes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The two men stare at each other.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lyn stares at him, disturbed, afraid this might be true.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Oh. Didn't mean to wake you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Heard you weren't feeling well?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Just tired.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: How'd you find us?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I told you. I remote viewed you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Scotty Mercer told you, didn't he?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah, he did. We told Scotty we were coming over here, asked him if he wanted some work.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I haven't seen Scotty.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That's funny, because he told me he'd run into you and mentioned that there might be some jobs going with us over here. (Beat) Isn't that why you came, really, Lyn? You want back in, don't you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It can happen. You've only got to say the word. Could be the new Golden Age for Psi research. (MORE)
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Larry closes his eyes, trying to remember something.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lyn listens, moved despite himself.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: You, me and Bill, back together again. Just like the old days.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Mother Earth, my life support system. As a soldier I must drink your blue water, live inside your red clay and eat your green skin.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . BASE - NIGHT                                          160 Bill and Bob stand on a picnic table, under the full moon. Bill is leading Bob through some YOGA POSITIONS. Both are drunk.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) I pray my boots will always kiss your face and my footsteps match your heartbeat.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . ARMY BASE - TENT - NIGHT                              161 Lyn can't help but join in the prayer.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Carry my body through space and time. You are my connection to the Universe...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . BASE - NIGHT                                          162 Bill and Bob both stand in a difficult position - balanced on one leg.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As we watch Bill slowly topples forward off the table and crashes out of sight below.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) ...and all that comes after. I am yours and you are mine.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . ARMY BASE - ROOM - NIGHT                              163 The two men finish the prayer.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I salute you. (CONTINUED)
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: He pats Lyn's leg, walks out.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Don't make a decision now. Tell me in the morning.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . BASE - NIGHT                                          164 Bob is holding a concussed Bill who has a cut on his head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bill opens his eyes suddenly.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Bill? Bill are you okay?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I just saw Timothy Leary.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Timothy Leary's dead.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I know. He's had an idea.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . CORRIDOR/KITCHEN - NIGHT                              165 Bill and Bob head down the corridor. They pass a SOLDIER.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They walk on and reach the doors to the KITCHENS. The two men hesitate, look at each other... Then Bob walks in.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Good evening sir.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Getting some ice-cream.
dialogue.name: dialogue

result.heading: MORNING 166 PSIC WORKERS AND PSYOPS TROOPS

direction.raw_text: . BASE - CANTEEN - MORNING                              166 PSIC WORKERS AND PSYOPS TROOPS are all eating breakfast together, talking, laughing. Bob and Bill sit drinking coffee. Lyn appears with a tray and sits down beside Bob. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They eat in silence for a moment. Lyn turns to look out of the window to where Larry Hooper stands outside in the early morning sun, smoking a cigar and drinking coffee. He turns and notices Lyn, raises his cup, smiles. Lyn looks troubled. Bob suddenly leans into Lyn.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lyn turns to Bob puzzled.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lyn tries to puzzle this out but is distracted by Larry outside who seems to have noticed something in the sand at his feet - a small insect of some kind. He begins to watch it with strange fascination. After a moment he sinks to his knees in order to get a better look at it. One of the SOLDIERS notices and starts to laugh softly. His neighbor looks at him as if he's crazy then begins to laugh himself. Lyn looks around him, sensing the strange atmosphere creeping through the room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lyn turns to stare at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bob turns to stare at him.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Don't eat the jello.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Don't eat the jello.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What's going on?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We put LSD in the jello.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Bill showed me where Larry had bottles of LSD. So we put it in the jello mix last night.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And in the water.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I put it in the main water tank as well. (CONTINUED)
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Bob stares at him, aghast.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He pours himself another coffee.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Through the window we see Larry get on his belly to get a better look at the bug.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: But...we've drunk the water.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) (Into microphone) The weather? The weather is going to be HOT!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . RADIO STATION - MORNING                               167 The DJ SOLDIER has gone off script. A PRODUCER is trying ineffectually to pull him away from the desk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Producer pulls and releases the DJ's headphones so they slap against his head and starts giggling.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He hits a button.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (Into microphone) I'm guessing. I mean, I haven't looked at the, the thing but I'd say it's going to be fucking HOT! Hot. Hot. Hot.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That hurt Greg, you fucking dip- shit. (Laughing too)You fuckity fuck dip-shit fuck-hole. (Remembering something) Hey! Music!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . BASE - MORNING                                        168 CLOSE on a LOUDSPEAKER - blasting a period song out over the base. We BOOM down to where two SOLDIERS are dancing, tripping.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Soldiers are wandering around, talking, some falling to their knees, weak with laughter. Some stand alone, staring with a beatific smile at the sky. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As the music plays on a STRYKER ARMORED VEHICLE drives around the corner of a building, a SOLDIER standing up, arms raised, in the gun turret. The Stryker screeches into a clumsy skid, the Soldier having to hang on. The Stryker roars off again, heading straight for the GATES of the base.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Stryker veers left and smashes through the perimeter fence and out into the desert.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (calling down into the vehicle) You're going to hit the gates. You're going to hit the gates.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (CALMLY) It's okay. You missed them.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . RADIO STATION - MORNING                             169 The DJ and the Producer are wrestling over the sound desk, laughing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BASE - CORRIDOR                                     170 Bob and Bill walk towards the cell block.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Don't you think it might have been more sensible if we hadn't drunk the fucking water?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That might have aroused suspicion. But don't worry. Over the years I have built up a massive tolerance to all narcotics.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . CELL - MORNING                                      171 An IRAQI PRISONER looks up startled as the door to the cell is flung open and Bill stands, filling the doorway, bare-chested, wild-eyed and wild-haired.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: In the name of the New Earth Army and loving people everywhere I'm liberating this base!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . GOAT SHED - MORNING                                 172 Lyn slides open the door to the shed and begins to shoo the goats out into the light.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BASE - LATER                                        173 As the music continues Bob, Lyn and Bill appear leading a column of nervous IRAQI PRISONERS out of the building, towards the gates. Lyn and Bill are holding BABY GOATS in their ARMS. A tripping Bob is holding bunches of flowers - it's as close as they can get to the illustration from the New Earth Army Manual. Lyn holds up a hand to stop the procession. Larry stands in front of them, a GUN in his hand, his face blank. Lyn and Larry stare at each other. Then, unexpectedly, Larry starts to cry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Larry starts to raise the gun to his mouth. Pauses. Scratches his head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He wanders off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Over the loud-speakers we hear the opening of a period song.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Give me the gun Larry.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Wow. I'm hungry.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) (Over loudspeaker,
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: ) Hey! More music! (muffled) Get off, will ya?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (Beat, relieved) Okay, let's go.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Bob and Lyn stand at one side, Bill at the other, beckoning the prisoners through, hugging the prisoners as they pass through.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: We're very sorry. Ma'assalama. (CONTINUED)
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: One by one the Iraqis walk out through the broken fence, staring around them suspiciously, expecting a trap. Nothing happens, no one shoots them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Iraqis start to hurry away over the sand. Beyond them we can the Stryker, driving in circles in the desert, a NAKED SOLDIER stands whooping on top.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (WAVING) That's it. Keep going. Ma'assalama.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . BASE - LATER                                        175 Bob, tripping heavily, is staring with fascination at the sand trickling through his fingers. Suddenly we hear the building whine of the HELICOPTER engine starting up. Bob looks up, puzzled.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bill and Lyn sit in the chopper, Bill at the controls. Lyn is holding the flowers. Bob appears, hurrying over.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The helicopter begins to rise. Bob stands swaying, staring up. Lyn smiles sadly through the window, raises his hand. The Helicopter RISES - HIGHER AND HIGHER. Bob waves goodbye.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Wait! Wait for me! Where are you going...what about the mission?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (Over the sound of the engine) You are the mission Bob! You are the mission! Tell them what happened!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) At the time I was hurt that Lyn hadn't taken me with him. But now I know it was because he and Bill had already seen what was to come.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . DESERT - DAY                                          177 As the helicopter flies off into the blue.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The helicopter disappears altogether.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) Nobody knows exactly what happened. The official story is that their helicopter must have crashed, either because they were hit by an RPG or because...well, that's what happens when you fly a helicopter while you're tripping on acid. All I know is they've never been seen since. Like all Shaman they returned to the sky.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . MICHIGAN APARTMENT - EVENING                          178 WEEKS LATER. Bob sits typing, frowning with concentration.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) When I got back home I wrote the story up. Everything.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . OUTSIDE BOB'S OLD HOUSE - EVENING                     179 Bob sits in his car staring at his old home, across the road. Through the window we can see Bob's ex-wife Debora, eating dinner with Bob's ex-Editor - Dave.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) I sent it to the newspapers, the radio stations, the TV stations, because that was what Lyn wanted me to do. The people needed to know.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . BOB'S APARTMENT - EVENING                             180 Bob sits watching a Today style show on TV.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) I was ready for whatever they would do to me. I was ready to disappear. I was ready to go to prison. I was a Jedi and I was fighting for the New Earth Army. (MORE) (CONTINUED)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) (CONT'D) (Beat) But they didn't put me in prison. They did something much worse.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: And finally, US forces in Iraq are using what some are calling a cruel and unusual tool to break the resistance of Iraqi POWs, and many parents would agree! Some prisoners are being forced to listen to Barney the Purple Dinosaur sing the I Love You song. I think after an hour of that they'll spill the beans! Don't you? Let's go outside to Al for the weather. Bob watches, ashen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NEWSPAPER OFFICE - DAY                                 181 Bob is working for another small town newspaper. He sits at his desk, staring fixedly ahead at the wall.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bob stands up. He starts to walk down the office, his face set with grim determination.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bob quickens his pace.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bob is running. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) That was it. That was the only bit of my story that ran anywhere. And it was a joke. And if I ever needed proof of how the Dark Side have taken the beautiful dream of what a nation could be and had twisted it, destroyed it, that was it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Bob?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) But I won't stop. I won't give up.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) (CONT'D) Because when I look at what is happening in the world, I know that now, more than ever, we need to become ALL that we can BE.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Bob rushes towards the WALL. Just as he is about to hit it we FREEZE FRAME. We hear the opening of a period song.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Now, more than ever, we need the Supermen.
dialogue.name: dialogue
